masterFinding.verificationInstructions:
Verification Instructions

User enumeration is most often identified on login pages:
  1. Try logging in to the application using a valid username with invalid password

  2. Try logging in to the application using an invalid username and password

  3. Compare server responses; if the responses are different, username enumeration is possible


Reporting Requirements
  1. Screenshot response to invalid username / invalid password

  2. Screenshot response to valid username / invalid password - highlight the difference in responses
masterFinding.remediationInstructions: Return the same error message for both invalid and valid users when an invalid input is provided. Example: Login was unsuccessful.
masterFinding.name: User Enumeration - Error Messages
masterFinding.businessImpact: Leveraging this issue an attacker may be able to enumerate account which could be targeted in future attacks.
masterFinding.description: The application returns specific error messages notifying the end user if a username is valid or not based on the user input. As a result, an attacker may be able to enumerate valid usernames via brute force attacks.
